User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

My Settings
I am using Mac OS X Version 10.6.7 (older versions have this bug too).
I am using Photoshop CS5 (older versions of Photoshop have this bug too, and "Google Chrome" doesn't have this problem, which results me in using chrome just to get around the bug)
Bug remains even after doing a clean install of the browser

Story: This bug has been present since firefox 3, a quick google search for "cant drag images into Photoshop from firefox" reveals the severity of the problem results. I am surprised that no one has reported this issue in SUCH A LONG TIME or expressed how frustrating the bug is. Almost all of the designers that I know who use a Mac complain about this issue, including myself. Gotta have some love for the designers who use a Mac, for the love of firefox please have this looked at =(

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Find an image
2. Drag image into Photoshop
3. Read the Photoshop error message
Actual Results:  
I got an error message:
Could not complete your request because Photoshop does not recognize this type of file.

Expected Results:  
It should have opened the image

This bug has been present since firefox 3, a quick google search for "cant drag images into Photoshop from firefox" reveals the severity of the problem results. I am surprised that no one has reported this issue in SUCH A LONG TIME or expressed how frustrating the bug is. Almost all of the designers that I know who use a Mac complain about this issue, including myself. Gotta have some love for the designers who use a Mac, for the love of firefox please have this looked at =(

comments.text:
Yes, the bug is still there (and has always been). Photoshop still throws the error "Could not complete your request because Photoshop does not recognize this type of file." when trying to drag and drop an image from the browser to the Photoshop dock icon.

Nightly 17.0a1 (2012-08-03)
Photoshop CS6

Only "simple" workaround for designers is to use the "Open With Photoshop" add-on: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/open-with-photoshop/ - but that's not a real solution.

comments.text:
Here's a screen recording I just made to demonstrate the problem: http://cl.ly/3u2I2s1h353x
The first part of the video shows Safari (working), and second part shows Firefox (throwing errors).

Here's the URL of the test page I made: 
http://maxart.s3.amazonaws.com/public/Firefox-image-drag-and-drop/index.html

Once again, this bug isn't specific to a particular version of Firefox or Photoshop. Drag and dropping an image from Firefox to Photoshop just never worked - while it works without issues with Chrome and Safari for instance.

Is this just a Photoshop issue? Dragging images from Firefox rarely (never?) works in macOS; it usually just drops a URL. E.g. try dragging an image into a Keynote presentation and you’ll get a text box with a URL in Firefox, and an image with Safari and Chrome.
